elements.2211.03217_f15eb624a022cbace076d5a22638d: Deliberation networks are a family of sequence-to-sequence models, which have achieved state-of-the-art performance in a wide range of tasks such as machine translation and speech synthesis
elements.2211.03217_d2387d07fcdb66532af6297914f40: A deliberation network consists of multiple standard sequence-to-sequence models, each one conditioned on the initial input and the output of the previous model
elements.2211.03217_4ca0854d3cc30ff1cb16076a457a6: During training, there are several key questions: whether to apply Monte Carlo approximation to the gradients or the loss, whether to train the standard models jointly or separately, whether to run an intermediate model in teacher forcing or free running mode, whether to apply task-specific techniques
elements.2211.03217_10f3cb27330af378db2dd42d77d10: Previous work on deliberation networks typically explores one or two training options for a specific task
elements.2211.03217_e4664ec26ed6f229011f0284773f7: This work introduces a unifying framework, covering various training options, and addresses the above questions
elements.2211.03217_40d388f3adc69b7821e7bcd53143f: In general, it is simpler to approximate the gradients
elements.2211.03217_0343c952834dd148609ab1f9a5c34: When parallel training is essential, separate training should be adopted
elements.2211.03217_3aa4c43b9d0187147a8f51b312dbd: Regardless of the task, the intermediate model should be in free running mode
elements.2211.03217_b829f5f03954cadc71f5f8541ceaf: For tasks where the output is continuous, a guided attention loss can be used to prevent degradation into a standard model.
elements.2211.03217_812612bcb1238061dc38baca4ddc0: Auto-regressive sequence-to-sequence (seq2seq) models with attention mechanisms are used in a variety of areas including Neural Machine Translation (NMT)
elements.2211.03217_e1bdcefb67f83312fa784f5e59bc4: These models excel at connecting sequences of different length, but can be difficult to train
elements.2211.03217_10cf71093dafa3711d85513fcfab1: A standard approach is teacher forcing, which guides a model with reference output history during training
elements.2211.03217_80373b7f3cf321ec98f67600a9a6e: This makes the model unlikely to recover from its mistakes during inference, where the reference output is replaced by generated output
elements.2211.03217_aad7176735d2e6fbc92a8eaf83134: This issue is often referred to as exposure bias.
elements.2211.03217_a47ad60d59dd25d2cc8e5ae5396c2: Several approaches have been introduced to tackle this issue, namely scheduled sampling
elements.2211.03217_0d52be6ebbc619163bd9a8f2b7977: These approaches require sequential generation during training, and cannot be directly applied when parallel training is a priority.
elements.2211.03217_4879c533abbfd95858ad31402a0ed: are a family of multi-pass seq2seq models, and can be viewed as a parallelizable alternative approach to addressing exposure bias
elements.2211.03217_4e56e3d7647ecef84710b8b9c315b: Here the output sequence is generated in multiple passes, each one conditioned on the initial input and the output of the previous pass
elements.2211.03217_2a8ff202cd549844d74139f32662e: For multi-pass seq2seq models, there are many choices to make during training, e.g. whether to update the parameters of each pass separately or jointly
elements.2211.03217_4929ce192d5d9d37c8e820c7490f0: on deliberation networks typically focuses on a specific task, and explores one or two training options
elements.2211.03217_294334e5eb48c98cd93122495557c: This work introduces a unifying framework, covering various training options in a task-agnostic fashion, and then investigates task-specific techniques.
elements.2211.03217_b0069ce381773371da7a0bf54a2ad: The novelties of this paper are as follows
elements.2211.03217_98d911cbb51faa4bfbf21b3490ea8: describes the framework from a probabilistic perspective, and section
elements.2211.03217_5cca5092d7d93ea7427ac5a6151c5: investigates a range of training approaches
elements.2211.03217_1fa2bb731e41352a65f1428a63d47: takes a deterministic perspective, and describes the one or two training approaches adopted in the experiments
elements.2211.03217_e5f216e951aadd8b85f5da2e22fe5: draws the connection between the training of deliberation networks and Minimum Bayes Risk (MBR) training
elements.2211.03217_ae896bc44be05fd0a42dbf0c01a53: Leveraging the connection, the end of section
elements.2211.03217_b93cb89ddcb403862e1e021c36499: introduces a novel training approach, which approximates the loss, unlike previous work
elements.2211.03217_c9cd0b093c8ffe16b5ce59b5e846d: The separate training approach described in section
elements.2211.03217_4882d423399dc66a7865112868c31: is not novel, but its synergy with parallel training is pointed out for the first time
elements.2211.03217_65cb1220d9d81fe53ab3b8f0f5ad8: reviews several techniques facilitating the application of deliberation networks to specific tasks.
elements.2211.03217_812d49676fe0af7a83bade8b08e0e: Sequence-to-sequence (seq2seq) generation can be defined as the task of mapping an input sequence
elements.2211.03217_c5a5ec3c3f5b740c4c9c3af48a8c1: The two sequences do not need to be aligned or have the same length
elements.2211.03217_e4be693f65518ed2163a88d73790d: From a probabilistic perspective, a model
elements.2211.03217_07feb51d52276bf150fc2f66bf050: For autoregressive models, this can be formulated as
elements.2211.03217_84d2641adfe6b07707ab0d2aac41a: Attention-based sequence-to-sequence models usually have the encoder-attention-decoder architecture
elements.2211.03217_f4bda47a1309e29b68442e4d53054: The distribution of a token is conditioned on the back-history, the input sequence and and attention map:
elements.2211.03217_f78c5b125737621cf62afad1edd9b: is an alignment vector, i.e. a set of attention weights;
elements.2211.03217_c78a1418429a45171301a296e9f69: is a state vector representing the output history

elements.2211.03217_9480c86853f1a6ad27284aad8ca9c: can be obtained from the distribution estimated by the model
elements.2211.03217_44d751c1ba496c58920bea54c825b: The exact search is often too expensive and is often approximated by greedy search for continuous output, or beam search for discrete output
elements.2211.03217_6672a80bab8b49d021baa7a9d3ceb: Conceptually, the model is trained to learn the natural distribution, e.g. through minimizing the KL-divergence between the natural distribution
elements.2211.03217_86c08392411de17249256c37cd4ec: In practice, this can be approximated by minimizing the Negative Log-Likelihood (NLL) over some training data

elements.2211.03217_4d382cc144498f9a1045b72c2b34b: To simplify the notation, the data index is omitted for the length of the sequences, although they also vary with the index
elements.2211.03217_8a8dd214ed365ade25ff51517dbe1: In the following sections, the sum over the training set
elements.2211.03217_4f7b84e8064e31f29ec77fa3814a6: For autoregressive models, and the sequence distribution
elements.2211.03217_0a4777add06dc7cd3edbf9649b2da: is factorized across time, as shown in equation
elements.2211.03217_5a986f648033e407791ebe4dfd2bd: A key question then, is how to compute the token distribution
elements.2211.03217_b630fbcc34126e52d95abda7d80ed: For teacher forcing, at each time step
elements.2211.03217_3704dd443f1c9d8a70a8c94761e97: , the token distribution is computed with the correct output history
elements.2211.03217_23b1b609e4807daca4a607ce73833: In this case, the loss can be written as:
elements.2211.03217_a9555e5461c45e212d1cb3b9f1f1a: From a theoretical point of view, this approach yields the correct model (zero KL-divergence) if the following assumptions hold: 1) the model is powerful enough ; 2) the model is optimized correctly; 3) there is enough training data to approximate the expectation shown in equation
elements.2211.03217_b39b9e0a120d06ac0b28c5ec7082b: In practice, these assumptions are often not true, hence the model is prone to mistakes
elements.2211.03217_459b25e43f7da0fa90cb9a3121a69: From a different perspective, teacher forcing suffers from exposure bias
elements.2211.03217_59525e20f4c1e0763ffa613c1d432: , which refers to the following problem
elements.2211.03217_9ccca0807277c9bc004ef45ad9d1d: During training, the model is guided by the reference output history
elements.2211.03217_1d27838425a3caaea04c8ab7bb1e6: At the inference stage, however, the generated output history must be used
elements.2211.03217_b0f2b0036f24799898bcfe372b239: Hence there is a train-inference mismatch, and the errors accumulate along the inference process
elements.2211.03217_7c9dd3f7f1e50909a958488e00923: Many approaches have been introduced to tackle exposure bias, and there are mainly two lines of research
elements.2211.03217_3082492e724c3157ce17ccd6bb349: are prominent examples along the first line
elements.2211.03217_1337077bb2c1a45a78da9ffad38c1: These approaches guide a model with both the reference and the generated output history, and the goal is to learn the data distribution via maximizing the likelihood of the training data
elements.2211.03217_29bf412631dde69f0f02d670efd91: To facilitate convergence, they often depend on a heuristic schedule or an auxiliary classifier, which can be difficult to design and tune
elements.2211.03217_d4d7423d7dcaf93da91675229e64f: The second line is a series of sequence-level training approaches, leveraging reinforcement learning
elements.2211.03217_b10bb21c07aa31df1aa86e1a10ca0: Theses approaches guide a model with the generated output history
elements.2211.03217_424d29f00c30d23b5dac6d32c39f9: During training, the model operates in free running mode, and the goal is not to generate the reference output, but to optimize a sequence-level loss
elements.2211.03217_e0685fd43e7989acc88a9c07e7844: However, many tasks do not have well established sequence-level objective metrics
elements.2211.03217_aab9734f72b69952b183a06104326: Examples include speech synthesis, voice conversion, machine translation and text summarization
elements.2211.03217_dd2007c1f51038c7d5b9683960b18: Both lines of research require generating output sequences, and this process is sequential for autoregressive models
elements.2211.03217_8956a1ad64389489137d8c6a45355: In recent years, models based on the Transformer
elements.2211.03217_593b0697dffd4630488481aa93089: have been widely used, and a key advantage is that when teacher forcing is used, training can be run in parallel across time
elements.2211.03217_f08e83425de0977de174774ebb80c: To efficiently generate output sequences from Transformer-based models, an approximation scheme
elements.2211.03217_f539c9159293ee3234d725b7cc274: has been proposed to parallelize scheduled sampling
elements.2211.03217_8144c30c20c43e9ddb5d5a47b1e78: For the above training approaches, the model is trained at the token-level, i.e. the loss is computed for each token and summed across time
elements.2211.03217_fe223878ce4b049a578b2eb781402: An alternative way of addressing exposure bias is to train the model at the sequence-level
elements.2211.03217_e1d7b53adbb84dc99c1b575d96a52: Here the loss is computed for sequences instead of tokens, and the model sees not only the reference output during training
elements.2211.03217_a81a2941f3501c6abfb3e7de8f818: This type of approaches can be described in the framework of Minimum Bayes Risk (MBR) training
elements.2211.03217_632da9d7fe40d71ca0f3c0a2769a5: Assume that there is a distance metric
elements.2211.03217_2f3a1bd8f6b4bb46ef7b157369da4: , whose probability is estimated with the model
elements.2211.03217_4a5b3f22d8ee0afc3717a59d3f06b: is minimal when the two sequences are equal
elements.2211.03217_49e2e0128876c6273eb393a63e556: MBR training minimizes its expected value:
elements.2211.03217_b927598a6d4f72172a0f3c01f99bf: Deliberation networks are inspired by a common human behavior: when producing a sequence, be it text or speech, we often revise the initial output to improve its quality
elements.2211.03217_32b4a3fdab992ea3874063a20c7af: For example, to write a good article, we usually first create a draft and then polish it
elements.2211.03217_6aa2769d12b512cbfb5f6a497d8e2: To record a section of an audio book, the readers often record several times until the quality is good enough
elements.2211.03217_2c24e0885c7d061767e967f77b21c: A deliberation network consists of multiple models
elements.2211.03217_cd2fba7ce102c69557795786e2f81: Its output is generated in multiple passes, each one conditioned on the initial input and the previous free running output
elements.2211.03217_524033516424cf3d64484cbd5b44b: With the iterative refinement, the final output is expected to be better than the previous ones
elements.2211.03217_b93ee3fc310f30cecd62652b582a9: For deliberation networks, an essential element is to condition all but the first model on its previous free running output
elements.2211.03217_0928b9baf696ff51149620843d31f: This allows the later models to learn to correct the free running output, alleviating exposure bias
elements.2211.03217_92b3a6b4577b236ac620d2a5643b8: Without loss of generality, this section describes a two-pass deliberation network, shown in figure

elements.2211.03217_ca2d52e0acde729a605aa7d64324d: The joint training scheme has several drawbacks.
elements.2211.03217_6a50b4462c3cf4cac98c42339cf02: As there is no loss over the intermediate output
elements.2211.03217_bbef0e816e23d79a826479d0b09c9: , it is likely to deviate from valid target sequences
elements.2211.03217_71aeaf91fb360104cb022c09c49b8: This makes it difficult to analyze the system
elements.2211.03217_224915b6781823773ff447e459ecf: is randomly initialized, the intermediate output will be close to random noise, making it difficult for
elements.2211.03217_0f2f25f75aece09905b3dc091e7d2: to learn to refine the intermediate output
elements.2211.03217_732f021ffa3602e3d678f6ee59443: In practice, it is common to pretrain
elements.2211.03217_12d6687d65d85c8706ae87b7f2861: with teacher forcing, in order to address these problems
elements.2211.03217_fd17614418ebbce75d0486f4e94f3: In terms of efficiency, one important problem is that the sampling process is very often auto-regressive, in which case joint training cannot be run in parallel
elements.2211.03217_d04e20bdd7172999110e2acf69439: Recently, Transformer-style models are widely used in various seq2seq tasks
elements.2211.03217_2e5140d40dc5ab983b3d4c9eff935: One of their main advantages is parallel training
elements.2211.03217_4b99a22660003b111601703467230: If teacher forcing is used, there is no recurrent connection in the model, and training can be done in parallel across the length
elements.2211.03217_16174ce65715989d1d93da8936ca3: However, if sampling is required, these models must operate sequentially, because the generated output history
elements.2211.03217_69a7a97795beb2572fe7bf52d3277: must be used, which is not available beforehand.

elements.2211.03217_a4ad88d629af2e3b3ba7051adadfd: In other words, during training, the output
elements.2211.03217_a3abd691f2a7bea6bad64bb9cc78c: is generated in free running mode, instead of teacher forcing mode
elements.2211.03217_7117db0c433314ca4c0af58966198: to fix the errors made by
elements.2211.03217_9cc6018d546274acbcd2292dd6cba: in free running mode, i.e. to address exposure bias
elements.2211.03217_7eed580be65182ac6a9f35bc9c572: Empirically, it is shown that if the
elements.2211.03217_5365618f5204186236ba191733c45: runs in teacher forcing mode while
elements.2211.03217_4f19810abecb6ed4aaba211e0c2a8: is trained, the network will not have any performance gain at the inference stage
elements.2211.03217_0a422005b0dded89202074a98b85f: Intuitively, when computing the distribution of
elements.2211.03217_17d7b39cf2d1865bedaaf21cc8bcd: This can be quantified by mutual information between
elements.2211.03217_e0643a4602cf08e1d95aff70aa544: Assuming that the expectation over the intermediate output is approximated by a single sample, the information gain can be formulated as:
elements.2211.03217_c7c0b501ae5b1b0a3355d1fa4fba9: Here the input sequence is omitted for simplicity.
elements.2211.03217_d6e48a2158e0e38117d93e556378b: denotes the information gain from condition the distribution of
elements.2211.03217_22eb4c45363a9a2ec04274198e67b: The intermediate output sequence is generated in free running mode, and is denoted
elements.2211.03217_3db42389e913981bdb1b71398dbef: Alternatively, the output sequence can be generated in teacher forcing mode
elements.2211.03217_06a22984d18fea0b8b3cdc89965c4: the alternative sequence, the information gain becomes:
elements.2211.03217_f4c4c8c9be7a7317ad5923a32ad72: , because the teacher forcing sequence is very similar to the reference sequence
elements.2211.03217_01db0a5e0589bc96bd3f66279b622: , and adds less information than the free running sequence
elements.2211.03217_0722a885dbb701a7c443b859620df: Experiments will be conducted in our future work to test this hypothesis
elements.2211.03217_196daa3086e18cfefaa8396f4acf6: So far in this section, it has been assumed that the goal of training is to learn a natural distribution
elements.2211.03217_fa0421c5d96d295e66e03340b2579: For example, the entire network can be trained with MBR training, as described in section
elements.2211.03217_6f4031219ad5c78b4f2b9a645eb85: This is often adopted in tasks with a gold-standard objective metric, e.g. word error rate for ASR
elements.2211.03217_79770a703cbd28d01b31e811da574: While this work focuses on supervised training, deliberation networks can also be used in unsupervised training
elements.2211.03217_bdc4bb2cf2dce224d5e39ecc8e9b2: For example, a cycle consistency loss can be used in tasks where there is not a lot of paired data, such as image-to-image translation and voice conversion
elements.2211.03217_1bd9df9e24808b6ac35ee2c28215d: When applying deliberation networks, it is essential to consider the nature of the input and the output
elements.2211.03217_667b4cca653719e0c23149f030954: There are two key factors to consider
elements.2211.03217_c84b415d33eabfba32a53c2f1af82: The first is whether the input and output have the same continuity
elements.2211.03217_8b1e971a692d0932b3a90aaf45a4d: If so, they can be embedded in the same way
elements.2211.03217_be236ab707b57961a0ba28a6b0102: Examples include NMT and voice conversion
elements.2211.03217_61af32d914eacd510da6bd11c9551: More precisely speaking, the initial input
elements.2211.03217_4432c3907c092e3bccc3e5f724dca: are either both continuous or both discrete
elements.2211.03217_bb9429622d63ccfd384bebd4fb6ea: Hence the additional encoder and attention mechanism for the first-pass output,
elements.2211.03217_d513a2b5382178efc415c808ea8f4: , can have exactly the same structure as those for the initial input,
elements.2211.03217_76c0c14192b27dabaac5c167ad4ed: When the input and output are different in terms of continuity, the additional encoder needs to be modified
elements.2211.03217_06c40f92c254c578079f4f7eb60b5: is a discrete text sequence, and
elements.2211.03217_efd341c65a31b0fbcd9ae2ea26057: Here the text embedding layer in
elements.2211.03217_3bdb77581c65e6d14d21702d26c93: can be replaced by a linear layer in
elements.2211.03217_36f204b7f717a031884438ba1e427: The second key factor to consider is whether the output is naturally discrete or continuous
elements.2211.03217_6e9700934615c6eba017cef36ef75: The rest of this section will discuss both cases.
elements.2211.03217_faab7125d60294dda60f6afba94ff: On a historical note, deliberation networks were first introduced for sequence-to-sequences tasks where both the input and output are text, such as NMT
elements.2211.03217_771d6e30653d4426b0280691e68a3: Their application was later extended to ASR, where the input is audio and the output is text
elements.2211.03217_5415688ce8cb637945e1fb5f6be57: For these tasks, the additional attention connects two text sequences, which are naturally discrete
elements.2211.03217_445bb3602121f1d61b3db65a289b6: Compared with audio sequences, which are naturally continuous, text sequences are usually shorter and the tokens are less correlated in time
elements.2211.03217_b793075965bec87651feff9df960e: Therefore, it is easier for the additional attention to learn to align the sequences, and the standard training approaches in section
elements.2211.03217_6e76db0e7205f36fc26adb358f85c: When it comes to ASR, streaming is an increasingly important demand
elements.2211.03217_a32abadfe9a083f7427c6e5cfed14: Typically, the first-pass model is a streaming model such as RNN-Transducer (RNN-T)
elements.2211.03217_7770d05a9818a5bd423b51c6b7484: , and the RNN-T loss for the first-pass model is combined with the likelihood loss for the second-pass model, described in section
elements.2211.03217_f9d3fe79db9d8ca382dffbe67c550: In some cases, MBR training is also applied to the second-pass model, directly optimizing the word error rate
elements.2211.03217_fad7f6d20918a44eba2f162e81f7a: To improve the streaming outputs, the second-pass model often adopts more powerful building blocks, such as Transformer blocks
elements.2211.03217_0c948165f593c4979976e06ed1463: The most common training scheme is separate training followed by joint training
elements.2211.03217_df92e9b5c0d44dd513f0c41c54772: During joint training, the first-pass model generates samples sequentially, but this is less problematic than the other application cases, thanks to the efficiency of the first-pass model.
elements.2211.03217_e9e4dbb462179a25a6bd7bffd3a0c: Continuous sequences, such as audio, are usually longer than discrete sequences, such as text
elements.2211.03217_492006db24832b829a1d0ffddee69: In general, longer sequences are harder for the attention mechanism, and reducing the time resolution alleviates the problem
elements.2211.03217_3b554bd50294c602b9e13a45424e9: For example, a pyramid encoder is often used in attention-based ASR models
elements.2211.03217_69f76eada208fbd24b810348e6900: Alternatively, when applying deliberation networks to TTS, adjacent frames in the first-pass output
elements.2211.03217_8c07764689a4d0cdbd9525ed02019: can be stacked in groups, forming a shorter sequence, before being fed into the encoder
elements.2211.03217_9be5cc32469749d9525850f10a865: Another challenge for continuous sequences is the strong correlation across time, i.e. among the tokens, which makes it hard to find the right tokens to focus on
elements.2211.03217_4089e400467120ff68bef44c88ab6: For deliberation networks, the second-pass model has two sources of information: the initial input sequence
elements.2211.03217_7f0aabdd762f0eb26f88d45bdec35: is continuous, the second-pass model is likely to ignore
elements.2211.03217_319644ce7030e9a12288e8dac6f9a: can be enough for reaching a local optimum during training
elements.2211.03217_4d8e9e02b7c6acedf103177df5c05: In this case, the attention over
elements.2211.03217_1e4f1225a52e88e5d1bde540b67db: does not produce any meaningful alignment, and the deliberation network degrades into a standard single-pass model
elements.2211.03217_25cabc8cd6bcb27bd3ae3cb088a2a: To tackle this issue, the attention can be regularized
elements.2211.03217_f9d45607d8fb7d987f0d61d97cbba: This is relatively simple when the attention is expected to be monotonic
elements.2211.03217_033b42e7927ee553d7d03ebf43185: For example, when applying deliberation networks to TTS, a guided attention loss
elements.2211.03217_e093d039c1ca8252038cb16937f1a: is a hyperparameter controlling the sharpness, and
elements.2211.03217_d84a636cc7048290a4230d7df8109: is an element of the attention map
elements.2211.03217_8278abea4250b76beb5b9ac8529e9: to make more extensive use of
elements.2211.03217_a7764be9eeb7d2d41bb2d07ed142d: is used, it is important to monitor
elements.2211.03217_3d862a0e53bc4a326e17f5606dc23: and the inference performance on a validation set via objective metrics such as Global Variance
elements.2211.03217_7b49433896f0deb266bfef54b47d4: is low, but the inference performance may degrade.
elements.2211.03217_6f2f46a79a0ed770df07d763d02eb: This paper introduces a unifying framework for deliberation networks, investigating various training options and application considerations
elements.2211.03217_27a4c5d341756fc7dfbf10508b1de: The key insights are as follows
elements.2211.03217_0bdd64a25e77cd9257d75fcc013dd: First, to deal with the intractable marginalization of the intermediate output, it is simpler to apply Monte Carlo approximation to the gradients instead of the loss
elements.2211.03217_aa5821181253cd05dcbf860174c1a: Second, parallel training is possible for deliberation networks, as long as each pass is trained separately
elements.2211.03217_7925a851d601540362ab631863d56: Third, regardless of the application, it is essential that when training the parameters of a certain pass, its previous pass runs in free running mode
elements.2211.03217_905ab23a5254b1140044aaf630e81: Finally, for applications where the output is continuous, a guided attention loss can be used to prevent the multi-pass model from degrading into a single-pass model.
